intro: Kentrosiphon saccatus subsp. steingroeveri, commonly known as the narrowleaf kentrosiphon, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It has pinnately compound leaves with serrated margins. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to harsh environmental conditions.
